definitions: To stab someone with a homemade knife or other sharp object.
To hit a golf ball with the part of the club where the head joins the shaft, causing it to go sharply to the right (for a right-handed player).
To cut the shank (lower part of the leg) from an animal carcass.
examples: He threatened to shank his cellmate.
I shanked my approach shot into the water.
The butcher will shank the lamb for stew.
